title: Super Bowl Commercials: Fun Ads with Stars and New Ideas
summary: The Super Bowl is a big football game watched by over 120 million people in the U.S. This year, many companies are making special commercials to show during the game. They use famous people like Kendall Jenner and George Clooney to make their ads fun and memorable. The ads also include horses from Budweiser and scenes from movies like Jurassic Park. This year, some ads will talk about weight-loss drugs and AI technology. Experts say the ads will be light and silly to help people have fun and forget about serious news. Companies pay a lot of money, up to $10 million, for just 30 seconds of ad time because so many people watch the game. The Super Bowl ads show what is popular in America each year.

background_read: The Super Bowl is an annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL) in the United States. It is one of the most-watched TV events, with millions of viewers. Companies create special commercials called Super Bowl ads to reach this large audience. These ads often feature celebrities, humor, and new products to make them memorable. Over the years, Super Bowl ads have reflected trends in technology, health, and pop culture, showing what is important or popular in America at that time.
Article_Structure: WHO: Companies and advertisers making commercials for the Super Bowl
WHAT: Special ads with celebrities, weight-loss drugs, and AI shown during the football game
WHERE: On TV and streaming platforms in the U.S. during the Super Bowl
WHY: To sell products and entertain over 120 million viewers
